title: 2025 Summer Intern - Global Wealth Management, Growth Markets
description:
PIMCO is a global leader in active fixed income. With our launch in 1971 in Newport Beach, California, PIMCO introduced investors to a total return approach to fixed income investing. In the 50+ years since, we have worked relentlessly to help millions of investors pursue their objectives – regardless of shifting marketing conditions. As active investors, our goal is not just to find opportunities, but to create them. To this end, we remain firmly committed to the pursuit of our mission: delivering superior investment returns, solutions, and service to our clients.
Since 1971, our people have shaped our organization through a high-performance inclusive culture, in which we celebrate diverse thinking. We invest in our people and strive to imprint our CORE values of Collaboration, Openness, Responsibility and Excellence. We believe each of us is here to help others succeed and this has led to PIMCO being recognized as an innovator, industry thought leader and trusted advisor to our clients.
2025 Summer Internship - U.S. Global Wealth Management, Growth Markets
Positions are located in New York, NY.
You're eligible to apply if you:* Are able to begin full time employment from a PIMCO office between January 2026 – August 2026
* Are enrolled at a university during the Fall 2025 semester (August 2025 – December 2025)
* Have a minimum 3.2 cumulative collegiate grade point average, on a 4.0 scale or the equivalent, at an accredited 4-year college or university
* Are business proficient in English


See Yourself as a Growth Markets Analyst:
Global Wealth Management (GWM)’s mission is to create industry leading experiences for financial intermediates and their individual investor clients while providing a strong contribution to PIMCO’s overall business results. PIMCO GWM is responsible for business strategy and client coverage for the intermediated individual investor segment of the market. Converge includes RIAs, family offices, banks/ brokerage firms, trust banks, platforms and sub-advisory relationships.
The Growth Markets Group within GWM focuses on the growth and ongoing institutionalization of product and vehicle extensions through teams dedicated to Alternatives, Exchange-Traded Funds, Models, and Separately Managed Accounts.
Responsibilities for this role include:* Conducting research on market trends, competitor offerings, economic indicators, and investment products to support the broader team’s ability to differentiate PIMCO’s solutions for clients.
* Using data analytics tools to analyze portfolios, investment performance, and market data to support business development/client servicing and internal strategic decision-making.
* Assisting in the development and execution of vehicle business plans in collaboration with GWM stakeholders, including sales and product strategy teams.


You'll excel as a Growth Markets Analyst if you:* Show strong interest in the financial markets, macroeconomics, and investment finance as demonstrated through relevant coursework, certifications, internship/work experience and/or professional & club participation
* Possess solid foundation in finance and economics, and familiarity with basic investment concepts
* Have the ability to articulate ideas/strategies clearly, both verbally and in writing
* Demonstrate ability to conduct research and analyze complex data to identify trends and draw meaningful insights;
* Possess the ability to develop relationships into strategic partnerships, both internally and externally with clients
* Are personable, ethical, collaborative, organized, adaptable, problem-solver, self-starter, accountable
* Have the ability to multi-task and handle several projects delivering completed work within expected timeline; while maintaining high level of attention to detail
* Demonstrate high level of proficiency with Microsoft Excel


While our eligibility requirements are not flexible, we encourage you to apply even if you do not possess 100% of the desired skills outlined above.
The PIMCO Internship Experience:* The PIMCO Internship Program runs between Monday, June 9 – Friday, August 15, 2025 with the expectation that you will be available for the full duration of the program
* During Week 1, you’ll participate in PIMCO Fundamentals Training, providing you with the skills, knowledge, and relationships that will prepare you for success
* Alongside your colleagues, participate in PIMCO's Global Month of Volunteering, developed to heighten the impact of our employees' worldwide volunteer efforts
* Join us for a variety of cross-divisional education, networking & social events!
* Your supervisor, peer mentor, senior leaders and team offer guidance and mentorship throughout the summer
* You’ll receive feedback at mid- and end-of-summer as part of a formal review process to keep you on the path to meeting your summer goals
* Want to learn more? Hear about The PIMCO Internship Experience from past interns
* As a PIMCO intern, you’ll receive competitive compensation, along with a transition bonus to help with relocation to one of our office locations


How you should apply:
Applications open mid-August 2024. We review applications on a rolling basis and encourage you to apply by submitting your resume as soon as you are ready.
What to expect during the interview process:* After we receive your application, we'll conduct an initial resume review
* If selected to move forward, you’ll showcase your interests, skills, and personality by completing a one-way video interview
* Following the video interview and if selected to move forward, you'll meet with us during final-round interviews conducted live via video conference. Interviews typically consist of behavioral and technical concepts.


PIMCO is an equal opportunity employer committed to creating an inclusive, cognitively diverse environment.
For more information on PIMCO and Career Opportunities, please visit https://www.pimco.com/us/en/about-us/careers
PIMCO follows a total compensation approach when rewarding employees which includes a base salary and a discretionary bonus. Base salary is the fixed component of compensation that is determined by core job responsibilities, relevant experience, internal level, and market factors. The discretionary bonus is used to award performance and therefore is determined by company, business, team, and individual performance.  


Hourly Rate: $ 43.26
Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action Statement*PIMCO recruits and hires qualified candidates without regard to race, national origin, ancestry, religion (including religious dress and grooming practices), sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, breastfeeding, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender (including gender identity and expression), age, military or veteran status, disability (physical or mental), any factor prohibited by law, and as such affirms in policy and practice to support and promote the concept of equal employment opportunity and affirmative action, in accordance with all applicable federal, state, provincial and municipal laws. The company also prohibits discrimination on other basis such as medical condition, or marital status under applicable laws.*
Applicants with Disabilities*PIMCO is an Equal Employment* *Opportunity/Affirmative* *Action employer. We provide reasonable accommodation for qualified individuals with disabilities, including veterans, in job application procedures. If you have any difficulty using our online system due to a disability and you would like to request an accommodation, you may contact us at 949-720-7744 and leave a message. This is a dedicated line designed exclusively to assist job seekers with disabilities to apply online. Only messages left for this purpose will be considered. A response to your request may take up to two business days.*

title: Lead Product Designer
description:
**About us:**
-------------


Hedra is a pioneering video foundation model company founded by former Stanford PhDs backed by top investors at Index, A16Z Games, and Abstract Ventures. We're building a unified creation studio that empowers users to generate dialogue, audio, and video, effectively automating their digital presence.


Our flagship product, Character-1, launched in late June and has already garnered national attention, landing us on the top of Reddit (multiple times!) and Twitter, while attracting over 450,000 registered users and generating millions of videos. We raised 10 million dollars in our seed round to revolutionize content creation.


As we continue to expand, we're seeking a dynamic individual to lead design and propel Hedra to new heights.

**Note: Hedra is not a 9-5 job, we’re a team of passionate individuals seeking to fundamentally change content and build a generational company together. You must be willing to work in-person in either NYC or SF.**


Learn about the founders.

**About the role:**
-------------------


As our Lead Designer, you will design our foundational tools which allow our users imagine and direct stories through characters and worlds.

* You will own end-to-end design for our products video creation tools across mobile and desktop. You will craft every detail of new product features, from idea to UX to pixel-perfect execution.
* You will work with passionate engineers and top researchers to build a truly disruptive and novel technology.
* You will work closely with the founders to shape the product strategy and realize it though world-class intuitive user experience.
* You will create new patterns that are intuitive, practical, and convergent. You will Evolve our design system intentionally as we scale.


We’re looking for full-time hires, ideally you will you join us at our office in San Francisco.

**Skills You'll Need to Bring:**
--------------------------------

**User-Centered Design and Consumer Obsession.** Have 5+ years of experience designing and shipping complex, yet intuitive consumer products across mobile and web. You seek to understand the needs of consumers and can map the needs to technological capabilities, business, and roadmap.

**Creative and Authoring Tools.** Have 2+ years of experience building accessible video creativity tools spanning consumer and enterprise users. More importantly, you're passionate about enabling a new generation of creators and storytellers.

**Impeccable Craft.** Excellent design craft and the ability to blend that with strong intuition for business and product strategy. You create clear, intuitive, and visually appealing human interfaces.

**Startup Mindset.** You value velocity and execution, communicate clearly, and focus on building what will matter to users and the product. You are resourceful at finding creative ways to overcome challenges.

**Self-Motivated and Independent.** You are able to set accurate timelines for development and deliver on them. You have an opinion and the experience to back up that opinion.

***And most importantly, treat Hedra as your own and help shape the vision accordingly.***

**Nice to haves:**
------------------

* Prior experience crafting design strategy for GenAI, social platform experiences, and/or systems.
* Design leadership and experience building and scaling design teams and mentoring designers. Knowledge of best hiring practices.
* Deep knowledge around and passion for accessible and inclusive design.

**Highlights:**
---------------

* Create world-class brand, product and user experience directly with founders from 0 to 1. You will report to and work with the Co-founder and Chief Executive officer closely.
* Join a smart and energetic team with emphasis on individual development.
* Take big ownership, deliver a huge impact on product quality via diverse challenges and achievements.

**Benefits:**
-------------

* Competitive compensation and equity.
* 401k (no match).
* Healthcare (Silver PPO Medical, Vision, Dental).
* Gym access (at our office).


We hire talented and passionate people from a variety of backgrounds because we want our employee base to represent the wide diversity of our customers. If you’re excited about a role but your past experience doesn’t align perfectly with every bullet point listed in the job description, we still encourage you to apply. If you’re a builder at heart, share our company values, and enthusiastic about making storytelling and video production ubiquitous, we want to hear from you.


Hedra is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate in hiring or any employment decision based on race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), marital status, ancestry, physical or mental disability, genetic information, veteran status, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, or other applicable legally protected characteristic. Hedra considers qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law. Hedra is also committed to providing reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities and disabled veterans in our job application procedures. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, please let us recruiter know.


Hedra is committed to providing highly competitive cash compensation, equity, and benefits. The compensation offered for this role will be based on multiple factors such as location, the role’s scope and complexity, and the candidate’s experience and expertise, and may vary from the range provided below. For roles based in San Francisco, the estimated base salary range for this role is $130,000-$150,000 in addition to a competitive equity.


Compensation Range: $130K - $170K

title: Veterinary Assistant Practice Manager
description:
**BluePearl Pet Hospital i****s seeking an experienced** **Assistant** **Practice Manager to join our state-of-the-art emergency and specialty hospital located in Brooklyn, NY.**

 **Pay:** $37.40 - $54.70 / hour

**This pay band is a starting point and is dependent on experience.**

  

The Assistant Practice Manager assists the Practice Manager in the daily operational function of the hospital’s operations and assumes managerial responsibility for the hospital’s operations in the Practice Manager’s absence.

 **As the Assistant Practice Manager, you will****:**

* Direct and supervise associates.
* Create appropriate organizational environment and value systems that stimulate the morale and productivity of the workforce and its leadership.
* Collaborate with training and clinical staff to ensure that training and quality goals are met.
* Coach and lead through effective feedback to associates through the supervisory team.
* Monitor and evaluate operations on a daily basis.
* Partner with the Practice Manager to develop action plans to maximize hospital efficiency and supervise the implementation of improvements.
* Are responsible for all personnel functions including hiring, assignment and direction of work, development and training, disciplinary actions and termination, and the maintenance of all personnel records.
* Partner with the Practice Manager in budget preparation and ensure revenue targets and training goals are met.
* Review and approve employee schedules to accommodate the patient needs of the hospital.
* Ensure the adequacy and adjust inventory levels of all goods and supplies necessary for the operation of the hospital.
* Construct and submit timely and accurate reports on a daily/weekly/monthly or as required basis.
* Maintain thorough familiarity and ensure compliance with state and federal regulations, Standard Operating Procedures, and Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA) guidelines.
* Build rapport with clients and referring DVMs to ensure an overall high level of customer satisfaction with the hospital and services we provide.
* You minimize hospital liability through constant risk management review.
* You investigate all unsafe situations and situations/complaints.
* You work with the Practice Manager in creating and maintaining a positive team environment.
 **Why BluePearl?**

* Our passion is pets. We offer Trupanion pet insurance and discounts to our associates for pet treatments, procedures, and food.
* We encourage you to grow with us. Our technicians and assistants are leveled by their skillset and move up in level as they gain more skills and experience. We are focused on developing our associates into leaders through talent development programs and leadership workshops. As a member of Mars Veterinary Health, our associates have endless opportunities to advance in his/her career.
* In order to transform and lead the industry through innovative quality medicine and care, we understand the importance of continuous learning. We offer annual continuing education allowance, free continuing education sessions, our own BluePearl University for training, and our clinicians have access to over 2,000 medical journals.
* A regional licensed social worker who can provide guidance, advice, and tips/tricks on how to maintain a healthy lifestyle while working in a fast-paced emergency and specialty care environment.
* **Lyra;** Access to 12 mental health care sessions annually at no charge to you, and other well-being resources through Lyra- an online mental health support platform

  

We promote a family-like culture in our hospitals. We are all in this together. We believe in working together to lead the industry by enriching lives through remarkable care for pets.

* Company-paid Short-Term and Long-Term Disability
* Parental Leave Benefits
* Health, dental, vision, and life insurance options
* Paid Time Off and Floating Holiday Plans
* Health Savings Account
* Flexible Savings Account
* 401(k) Retirement Plan
* Annual Scrub Allowance: full-time associates receive $200/year in BluePearl store credit.
* Referral Bonus Program
* State licensure reimbursements
* VTNE reimbursements
* Additional VTS benefits – pursuing & established VTS technicians.
### ***BluePearl is committed to a diverse work environment in which all individuals are treated with respect and dignity. We are an equal opportunity*** ***employer,*** ***and each applicant will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, national origin, religion, creed, sex, age, disability, genetic information, marital status, citizenship status, sexual or affectional preference, or gender identity or expression, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. If you need assistance or accommodation during the application process because of a disability, it is available upon request. The company is pleased to provide such assistance, and no applicant will be penalized*** ***as a result of*** ***such a request. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and a Drug Free Workplace.***
company_description: With over 100 Specialty & Emergency Veterinary hospitals throughout the country, BluePearl seeks to be the top choice for pet medicine.

title: Veterinary Assistant - Critical Care
description:
**BluePearl** **Pet Hospital is seeking a knowledgeable and skilled Veterinary Assistant to join their Critical Care department at our Brooklyn, NY location.**


Schedule: Thursday - Saturday from 7am to 5pm.

 **Pay:** $22.20 - $32.80 / hour

**This pay band is a starting point and is dependent on experience and advancement through CareerTrax leveling system**.

  

Our Veterinary Assistants perform diagnostics (radiographs, labwork, etc), setting patients up in ICU or Inpatient ward, discharging patients, and handle client communication.

 **As a Critical Care Veterinary Assistant, you will:**

* Provide nursing care to patients according to hospital standards of care and core values.
* Report patient signalment, problem list and plan during nursing rounds.
* Understand classification of commonly used medications, associated side effects and appropriately monitors therapeutic response.
* Administer medications via appropriate routes and duration.
* Perform phlebotomy.
* Perform physical exam; accurately counts heart, pulse rate, capillary refill time, mucous membranes, temperature, respiratory rate and effort.
* Possess a working knowledge of anesthesia/monitoring equipment and assist with patients assigned ASA I or II classifications.
* Remain current on R.E.C.O.V.E.R CPR guidelines and demonstrates proficiency in designated role as assigned by attending clinician and/or supervisor.
 **Why** **BluePearl****?**

* Our passion is pets. We offer Trupanion pet insurance and discounts to our associates for pet treatments, procedures, and food.
* We encourage you to grow with us. Our associates are leveled by their skillset and move up in level as they gain more skills and experience. We are focused on developing our associates into leaders through talent development programs and leadership workshops. As a member of Mars Veterinary Health, our associates have endless opportunities to advance in their career.
* To transform and lead the industry through innovative quality medicine and care, we understand the importance of continuous learning. We offer annual continuing education allowance, free continuing education sessions, our own BluePearl University for training, and our clinicians have access to over 2,000 medical journals.
* We value your health and well-being as an associate by providing you with the following:
* Medical, dental, vision, and life insurance options.
* Parental leave benefits
* Flexible work schedules
* 401k and retirement planning
* Time to reset, rewind, and reflect through our paid time off and floating holiday plans
* A regional licensed social worker who can provide guidance, advice, and tips/tricks on how to maintain a healthy lifestyle while working in a fast-paced emergency and specialty care environment
* We promote a family-like culture in our hospitals. We are all in this together. We believe in working together to lead the industry by enriching lives through remarkable care for pets.

title: Overnight Veterinary Assistant - Emergency/Float
description:
BluePearl Pet Hospital is seeking a knowledgeable and skilled Emergency Veterinary Assistant to join their fast-paced **Overnight** emergency and specialty department at our Brooklyn, NY location. This position is primarily emergency and ICU focused, but will grant you an opportunity to train, shadow, and support alternative specialty services.


**Pay:** $22.15 - $32.80 / hour

**This pay band is a starting point and is dependent on experience and advancement through CareerTrax leveling system**.


We also offer competitive shift differential pay for eligible hours worked for nights and weekends.

* Shift differentials are based on a 4-hour minimum.


For example:

* Mon – Fri: 6pm to 8am = $4.50 Shift Differential
* Sat & Sun: 6pm to 8am = $6.00 Shift Differential
* Sat & Sun: 8am to 6pm = $4.50 Shift Differential

Our Veterinary Assistants triage emergency cases as they come in and assist DVM with crafting and going over estimates as needed. In addition, they perform diagnostics (radiographs, labwork, etc), setting patients up in ICU or Inpatient ward, discharging patients, and handle client communication.

 **As an Emergency** **Veterinary** **Assistant****,** **you will:**

* Provide nursing care to patients according to hospital standards of care and core values.
* Report patient signalment, problem list and plan during nursing rounds.
* Understand classification of commonly-used medications, associated side effects and appropriately monitors therapeutic response.
* Administer medications via appropriate routes and duration.
* Perform phlebotomy.
* Perform physical exam; accurately counts heart, pulse rate, capillary refill time, mucous membranes, temperature, respiratory rate and effort.
* Possess a working knowledge of anesthesia/monitoring equipment and assist with patients assigned ASA I or II classifications.
* Remain current on R.E.C.O.V.E.R CPR guidelines and demonstrates proficiency in designated role as assigned by attending clinician and/or supervisor.
 **Why BluePearl?**

* Our passion is pets. We offer Trupanion pet insurance and discounts to our associates for pet treatments, procedures, and food.
* We encourage you to grow with us. Our technicians are leveled by their skillset and move up in level as they gain more skills and experience. We are focused on developing our associates into leaders through talent development programs and leadership workshops. As a member of Mars Veterinary Health, our associates have endless opportunities to advance in his/her career.
* In order to transform and lead the industry through innovative quality medicine and care, we understand the importance of continuous learning. We offer annual continuing education allowance, free continuing education sessions, our own BluePearl University for training, and our clinicians have access to over 2,000 medical journals.
* A regional licensed social worker who can provide guidance, advice, and tips/tricks on how to maintain a healthy lifestyle while working in a fast-paced emergency and specialty care environment.
* **Lyra;** Access to 12 mental health care sessions annually at no charge to you, and other well-being resources through Lyra- an online mental health support platform
* We promote a family-like culture in our hospitals. We are all in this together. We believe in working together to lead the industry by enriching lives through remarkable care for pets.

  

Our Continuing Education Plan includes $500/year reimbursement for LVT and $750/year for VTS. The Continuing Education allowance can roll over up to $1,500 for CVT and VTS associates. Non-Credentialed, full-time Paraprofessionals are eligible for an annual CE stipend of $150. Full-time LVT associates also receive 8 hours of CE paid hours each year. Full-time VTS associates receive 12 hours of CE paid each year. Paid CE hours can be carried over year to year up to a maximum of 24 hours. Newly hired associates will receive a pro-rated amount of any CE benefit for which they are eligible.

* Company-paid Short-Term and Long-Term Disability
* Fertility and Parental Leave Benefits
* Health, dental, vision, and life insurance options
* Paid Time Off and Floating Holiday Plans
* Health Savings Account
* Flexible Savings Account
* 401(k) Retirement Plan
* Annual Scrub Allowance: full-time associates receive $200/year in BluePearl store credit.
* Referral Bonus Program
* State licensure reimbursements
* VTNE reimbursements
* Additional VTS benefits – pursuing & established VTS technicians.

BluePearl is committed to a diverse work environment in which all individuals are treated with respect and dignity. We are an equal opportunity employer and you will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, national origin, religion, creed, sex, age, disability, genetic information, marital status, citizenship status, sexual orientation, or gender identity or expression, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. If you need assistance or an accommodation during the application process because of a disability, it is available upon request. The company is pleased to provide such assistance, and no applicant will be penalized as a result of such a request. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and a Drug Free Workplace.

title: Overnight Veterinary Technician Supervisor
description:
BluePearl Pet Hospital is looking for an Overnight Veterinary Technician Supervisor with passion and the ability to help motivate, engage, and train a team of veterinary professionals at our Brooklyn, NY location.


We have schedules for:

**Pay:** $32.50 - $51.50 / hour

**This pay band is a starting point and is dependent on experience and advancement through CareerTrax leveling system**.

  

We also offer competitive shift differential pay for eligible hours worked for nights and weekends.

* Shift differentials are based on a 4-hour minimum.


For example:

* Mon – Fri: 6pm to 8am = $4.50 Shift Differential
* Sat & Sun: 6pm to 8am = $6.00 Shift Differential
* Sat & Sun: 8am to 6pm = $4.50 Shift Differential
  

We have an exciting opportunity for the right candidate to be a leader in a dynamic team of veterinary professionals. The ideal candidate will be excellent at training and mentoring. title: Finance Diagnostics Operations- Functional Partner and Sub-chapter Lead
description:
Roche fosters diversity, equity and inclusion, representing the communities we serve. When dealing with healthcare on a global scale, diversity is an essential ingredient to success. We believe that inclusion is key to understanding people’s varied healthcare needs. Together, we embrace individuality and share a passion for exceptional care. Join Roche, where every voice matters.


The Position**Who We Are**


At Roche, we are passionate about transforming patients’ lives and we are fearless in both decision and action - we believe that good business means a better world. That is why we come to work each day. We commit ourselves to scientific rigor, unassailable ethics, and access to medical innovations for all. We do this today to build a better tomorrow.

**The Opportunity**

*Finance Diagnostics Operations Purpose*


Diagnostics Finance Global Operations, Quality & Regulatory, Intercompany Supply Chain (ICSC) and Cross-Functional (FDO) is a finance organization with a global footprint all over the world and is part of the global Diagnostics finance organization. Since 2021 several different finance teams have been brought into the one FDO organization. The Transformation of Dia Finance for Global Operations, Q&R, ICSC and Cross-Functional has at its core the desire to create a lean Finance organization that embraces flexible ways of working and interfaces seamlessly with other parts of the Finance and Business units across Diagnostics while bringing strong value to our key stakeholders.

*Global Operations Purpose*


At Diagnostics Global Operations, our pursuit is in delivering industry-leading diagnostics to our customers. Our employees produce reagents and instruments that help diagnose disease and impact the lives of people all over the world. With our global manufacturing network and our supply chain hubs, our more than 6’500 employees ensure the timely delivery of world-leading, high-quality products for all Diagnostics Business Areas, fulfilling the Roche purpose of doing now what patients need next. Being a part of Global Operations, the DOG Cluster comprises sites in Branchburg, New Jersey and Carlsbad, California to manufacture, label, fill, pack, label, and store diagnostic products.

**Job Facts**

*In the role of Functional Partner you will have the following tasks and be responsible/ accountable for:*

* Accountable for the financial performance of Global Operations in Branchburg and Carlsbad to achieve the short, mid and long-term financial targets
* Act as the F2F Finance business partner to Global Operations in Branchburg and Carlsbad to its senior management for all economic aspects by providing meaningful strategic and operating insights and influencing decisions directly or indirectly
* Being an independent sparring partner to Global Operations for Branchburg and Carlsbad senior management and business partners and provide an unbiased point of view on the performance, supported by facts and evidence and challenges the status-quo
* Driving decision making with Global Operations for Branchburg and Carlsbad senior management and business partners by identifying value-adding opportunities, best use of resources and funding of business opportunities
* Leading local and global project across different Global Operations locations within their respective sub-chapter or across several sub-chapters of Global Operations Finance
* Providing meaningful and actionable input and insights to the monthly closing and forecasting including a storyline for stakeholders
* Accountable for the coordination and driving of planning activities and drive planning simplifications

*Subchapter lead, People, Ways of working, Mind-set, Leadership and One Finance:*

* Provide leadership and guidance to the finance community within the Reagents North America sub-chapter
* Accountable for aligning the resources with the respective functional partners to achieve the best outcomes for the respective Global Operations areas (DLT-1) and Finance
* Accountable for the long-term strategy of the subchapter to develop the subchapter to the desired level and ambition of the FDO transformation within the next years
* Embrace the role of leadership as a visionary, architect, catalyst and coach (VACC) and
  

live the Roche operating principles. Behave as a role model and foster growth across the rest of the organization. Willingness to let go of command and control and deliberately push decisions to the lowest level, empower teams to come up with innovative designs and solutions
* Establish the culture necessary for the subchapter to be successful and cultivate a motivating working environment which allows people to continue their professional journey and perceives FDO as a home to be
* Select, hire, develop and coach finance employees with the potential and willingness for increased local and global roles. Apply the Roche, Diagnostics and Finance leadership principles, ensure the cultural fit, Roche values and right mind-set to Roche
* Ensure appropriate training and skills of its people to develop the leaders and organization to a competitive level, accepted by the business and finance organization

**Who you Are**

* Advanced degree in Finance (or in a related field) is required; MA/MBA is a plus
* 8+ years work experience in Finance and broad Finance knowledge in different fields of Finance
* Demonstrated success in stakeholder management and business partnership in a global and local organization and experience in balancing interests from different functions
* Strong inspiring, communication, negotiation and influencing skills. Confident in leading and navigating complex topics and global projects
* Proven leader, with enterprise focus, promoting diverse and inclusive environments, and a focus on the right work for the highest impact

**Preferred Qualifications**

* Minimum of 5 years of leadership experience in a manufacturing environment
* Have a solid understanding of the Dia systems and reporting landscape
* A conceptual thinker with strong business acumen and strong analytical and quantitative skills.
* Able to navigate a complex, challenging environment based on agile principles
* Self-driven with a strong desire to experiment with new ways of working and piloting new areas and capabilities. Broad experience working in networks across geographies, business and roles.

*The expected salary range for this position based on the primary location of Branchburg, NJ is $162,500-301,700. Actual pay will be determined based on experience, qualifications, geographic location, and other job-related factors permitted by law. This position is eligible to earn incentive compensation that is calculated and paid in accordance with the applicable Incentive Compensation Plan for the role. This position also qualifies for the benefits detailed at the link provided below.*https://roche.ehr.com/default.ashx?CLASSNAME=splash

*Relocation benefits are available for this position.*


Who we are
At Roche, more than 100,000 people across 100 countries are pushing back the frontiers of healthcare. Working together, we’ve become one of the world’s leading research-focused healthcare groups. Our success is built on innovation, curiosity and diversity.


Roche is an equal opportunity employer and strictly prohibits unlawful discrimination based upon an individual’s race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity/expression, national origin/ancestry, age, mental/physical disability, medical condition, marital status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.


If you have a disability and need an accommodation in relation to the online application process, please contact us by completing this form Accommodations for Applicants.

title: Duane Reade Stockperson
description:
Stock associates are responsible for all aspects of the receiving area process. Responsibilities include processing incoming and outgoing freight, compiling and maintaining records pertaining to orders, receiving, supplies and equipment.  

  

**Essential Duties and Primary Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:*** Utilize merchandise moving equipment such as hand trucks or pallet jacks, to move shipments from receiving platform to storage area.
* Assist with unloading, handling and moving freight as needed.
* Unpack and examine incoming shipments and record overages, shortages and damaged items.
* Compare information on purchase orders and/or shipping notices to goods received to verify accuracy of order and maintain records of the same.
* Attach or change price tags on merchandise.
* Prepare merchandise for the sales floor.
* Deliver processed merchandise to the floor.
* Write, type or enter information into computer to maintain inventory, purchasing, shipping or other records.
* Respond to inquires regarding entered data.
* Ensure accuracy of documentation of outgoing shipments (i.e. transfer and manifest), and prepare shipments for pickup by weighing and affixing appropriate labels and fill out appropriate paperwork and logs and maintain records of the same.
* Assist in ringing up sales at registers and/or bagging merchandise.
* Any other tasks as assigned from time to time by any manager.

  

**Basic Qualifications**  

* Must be fluent in reading, writing, and speaking English.
* Requires willingness to work flexible schedule, including evenings and weekend hours.

  

**Preferred Qualifications**  

* Prefer six months of experience in a retail environment.
* Prefer to have prior work experience with Duane Reade.


An Equal Opportunity Employer, including disability/veterans.
The actual compensation that you will be offered will depend on a variety of factors including geography, skills and abilities, education, experience and other relevant factors. This role will remain open until filled. To review benefits, please click here jobs.walgreens.com/benefits. If you are applying on a job board or unable to click on the link, please copy and paste this URL into your browser jobs.walgreens.com/benefits

title: Duane Reade Pharmacy Technician
description:
Duane Reade is seeking a dynamic, flexible and motivated team player to join the Pharmacy department as a Pharmacy Technician. This position will be responsible for verification of prescription information within Duane Reade Pharmacies.  

  

**Essential Duties and Primary Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:*** Verifies that the prescription information is complete and accurate.
* Retrieves, counts, pours, weighs, measures and sometimes mixes medication.
* Prepares the prescription labels, selects the type of container and affixes the prescription and other labels to the container.
* Prices and files the prescription and insures that it is checked by a Pharmacist before it is given to the patient.
* May establish and maintain patient profiles, prepare insurance claim forms and stocks and takes inventory of prescription medications.
* Refers any questions regarding prescriptions, drug information or health matters to a Pharmacist.
* Performs any other duties as assigned by the Pharmacist.
* Scan merchandise on the register.
* Stock merchandise on the shelves.

  

**Basic Qualifications**  

* Must be fluent in reading, writing, and speaking English.
* Requires willingness to work flexible schedule, including evenings and weekend hours.

  

**Preferred Qualifications**  

* Prefer six months of experience in a retail environment.
* Prefer to have prior work experience with Duane Reade.
* Prefer good math skills so they can fill prescriptions accurately, including counting, measuring, weighing medications.
* Prefer good computer skills.
* Prefer knowledge of store inventory control.
* Prefer PTCB Certification


An Equal Opportunity Employer, including disability/veterans.

title: Duane Reade Pharmacy Cashier
description:
We are seeking a dynamic, results-oriented professional to join the Duane Reade team as a drug clerk. This person must have open availability to work days, nights and weekends as needed. The drug clerk is primarily the first and last impression the customer has, so they must be able to deliver a consistent top level of service that our customer expects.  

  

**Essential Duties and Primary Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:*** Greet customers/patients at the pharmacy department.
* Answer phones; take messages, over the counter orders with proper phone etiquette.
* Intake of new prescriptions and refill orders.
* Verify product availability and wait time for prescription dispensing.
* Patient look up and verifications.
* File prescriptions.
* Ensure signature log is completed for every prescription pick up.
* Cash drawer tie-out at start and finish of shifts maintaining adequate change.
* Process sales transaction by all payment methods available.
* Process merchandise returns, exchanges and vendor returns.
* Receive and check in pharmacy orders.
* Maintain a clean and orderly check out area.
* Photocopy and fax information as needed.
* Knowledgeable of Duane Reade store locations, product and available services.
* Other duties as assigned.

  

**Basic Qualifications**  

* Must be fluent in reading, writing, and speaking English.
* Requires willingness to work flexible schedule, including evenings and weekend hours.

  

**Preferred Qualifications**  

* Prefer six months of experience in a retail environment.
* Prefer to have prior work experience with Duane Reade.

title: Director Global Marketing Oncology - Hematology (MPN)
description:
**Job Description**


It is an exciting time to join our company's Global Hematology team, as we build an industry leading business and aspire to impact Myeloproliferative disease on a global scale. We have made significant progress advancing our hematology pipeline with seven registrational studies across our hematology assets with Essential Thrombocythemia being our first expected launch in MPNs.


The **Director of Global Marketing** for a first-in-class treatment will be responsible for supporting commercial elements related to launch. This is a business-critical role that will be instrumental in helping our Company build a leadership position in Essential Thrombocythemia and contributing to establishing Myeloproliferative Neoplasms (MPNs) as a key growth driver for our Company. This role reports to the Global Oncology Marketing Lead Exec. Director and will collaborate broadly with cross-functional partners to support enterprise-wide commercialization preparedness. Essential Thrombocythemia is a rare, indolent disease impacting patients and their loved ones. Despite availability of off-label, genericized chemotherapy, unmet need persists where disease awareness is needed to raise the patient voice. Our Company’s ability to make a meaningful impact on this disease for patients and their loved ones will be influenced by the leadership of this role.


The Director will play an important role in supporting the commercial transformation and leadership of our launches, including new ways of working, embedding advanced analytics, evolving the commercial models and building value for patients, payers and healthcare professionals.

**Specific Responsibilities Include:**

* Map the patient journey in collaboration with HHDDA and key markets to identify roadblocks that delay diagnosis and optimal treatment according to guidelines; and activate new innovative solutions to accelerate the journey.
* Drive the deployment of potential strategic initiatives to optimize the patients’ diagnosis journey, by addressing roadblocks at scale with AI, data/analytics and innovative partnerships. This is inclusive of defining the operational details of strategic initiatives, ensure appropriate execution in coordination with cross functional Global, Regional and Local stakeholders and allocating appropriate resourcing.
* Develop strategies and initiatives to drive earlier optimal treatment with our assets – when appropriate and according to approved indications - and enable rapid identification of patients that are not treated according to guidelines. This is inclusive of supporting the development of the initial strategy, create analytical approaches (including AI tools and techniques) to identify patients in coordination with HHDDA and coordinate with Regional and Local stakeholders to ensure execution.
* Set up a governance model that centralize multiple innovative activities and identify opportunities to scale up and drive impact in collaboration with HHI and Key Markets.
* Create a consistent and rigorous KPI framework that can track the acceleration across all launch markets.
* As a member of the global marketing team and cross functional leadership team, partner with Global Oncology to invest in each other’s development, build a culture of inclusivity, speak-up and stretch our collective team’s thinking by challenging the status quo for the purpose of creating stronger outcomes.

**Position Qualifications:**

 **Education Minimum Requirement:**

* Required - Bachelor's Degree
* Preferred Advanced Degree (MBA)

 **Required Experience and Skills:**

* Minimum of 6 years of progressive experience across marketing, sales, market access or related experiences in pharmaceutical or biotechnology industries
* **Entrepreneurship:** Understand key market dynamics and seize business opportunities. Proven track record of high-performance and driving business results.
* **Strategic Planning:** Proven ability to analyze complex data and create clear long-term customer centric strategies.
* **Change Catalyst**: Challenging Status Quo, Leading change to achieve strategic priorities.
* **Innovation:** Demonstrate ability to leverage innovation to drive novel solutions with measurable value to customers, create a culture to encourage experimentation.
* **Influence:** Ability to clearly articulate messages/information across the enterprise and to all levels, including highest levels of senior leadership.
* **Networking and Partnerships:** Strong collaboration skills, both within commercial teams and cross divisional teams including R&D and manufacturing, medical affairs, Outcomes Research and Access
* **Executional Excellence:** Ability to identify clear priorities, align stakeholders and frictionless execution of value-added outcomes for our customers.
* **Challenging Status Quo:** Ability to push past internal obstacles to drive initiatives forward.
* Prior product launch and promotional review experience preferred.

**Commute/Location:**

* We offer Hybrid Work Model (combination of 3 days In-office & 2 days offsite/remote). This position cannot be 100% remote.
* Applicant must have ability to work from our Headquarters sites in Rahway (NJ) or Upper Gwynedd (PA) with up to 25% Travel (including International).

**NOTICE FOR INTERNAL APPLICANTS**


In accordance with Managers' Policy - Job Posting and Employee Placement, all employees subject to this policy are required to have a minimum of twelve (12) months of service in current position prior to applying for open positions.


If you have been offered a separation benefits package, but have not yet reached your separation date and are offered a position within the salary and geographical parameters as set forth in the Summary Plan Description (SPD) of your separation package, then you are no longer eligible for your separation benefits package. To discuss in more detail, please contact your HRBP or Talent Acquisition Advisor.

**Employees working in roles that the Company determines require routine collaboration with external stakeholders, such as customer-facing commercial, or research-based roles, will be expected to comply not only with Company policy but also with policies established by such external stakeholders (for example, a requirement to be vaccinated against COVID-19 in order to access a facility or meet with stakeholders). Please understand that, as permitted by applicable law, if you have not been vaccinated against COVID-19 and an essential function of your job is to call on external stakeholders who require vaccination to enter their premises or engage in face-to-face meetings, then your employment may pose an undue burden to business operations, in which case you may not be offered employment, or your employment could be terminated. Please also note that, where permitted by applicable law, the Company reserves the right to require COVID-19 vaccinations for positions, such as in Global Employee Health, where the Company determines in its discretion that the nature of the role presents an increased risk of disease transmission.**

title: Business Analyst
description:
**BECOME OUR BEST INGREDIENT...**



Bring your talent to the mix at Empire Merchants, a world-class distributor of fine wines and spirits. Quality people are our best ingredient for success in this thriving, established industry. We are currently seeking a few exceptional people looking to grow their careers at a premier Distributor of Choice that serves more than 10,000 NY Metro area restaurants, hotels, clubs and retail outlets. In return, Empire Merchants can offer you the perfect combination of exceptional benefits and compensation, superior industry training on all levels along in a fun, high-energy environment. Want to look forward to Mondays?


**POSITION** **SUMMARY**



Responsible for drawing conclusions and making recommendations to management on an appropriate course of action by analyzing sales data, census data, competitive information, scan data, pricing figures, industry data and any other applicable sources of information. Analyses may include sales forecasting, opportunity identification and evaluation of program performance. Role also entails the development of sales templates, results tracking, extracting and manipulating data, and formatting of reports as requested by management as needed.


**ESSENTIAL POSITION RESULTS**


* Prepares materials for supplier planning meetings by aggregating and reviewing internal sales data, spend data, important demographic and socioeconomic developments and pricing and category trends. Attends and contributes to meetings as appropriate by providing any commentary on analyses or pulling relevant data during the meeting as necessary.
* Evaluates the potential impact of pricing modifications or prospective programming elements by reviewing pertinent sales data, research and comparable examples to forecast sales.
* Uncovers market and brand opportunities by developing an understanding of category, customer and market dynamics and using this knowledge to assess brand performance.
* Measures risk to sales plan (gap analysis) by comparing the plan to historical sales data, current trend information and marketplace developments; reports potential shortfalls to management.
* Develops sales templates; collaborates with Business Managers, Division Manager or Sales Leaders to identify business needs and designs appropriate, replicable reports. Trains administrative staff on process to recreate/run templates.
* Package data for sales materials by working with Business Manager/Marketing Director to ascertain needed information and converting data into concise facts and visuals that can be easily incorporated into sell sheets, concept sells or presentations.
* Uncovers drivers for important changes in sales performance by reviewing appropriate competitive and internal data.
* Measures ROI on selected programming by working with Business Managers and Marketing Director to determine evaluation criteria.
* Develops business review content by working with the Supplier, Business Manager and Sales Management to analyze sales performance, develop business case, and incorporate data into templates.
* Completes all necessary training programs by attending, participating, and passing all required tests as defined by management. (e.g. DIVER, ANALYTICAL TRAINING).
* Maintains customer and supplier confidence by keeping appropriate information confidential.
* Maintains a safe and clean working environment by complying with procedures, rules and regulations.
* Contributes to team effort by accomplishing related results as needed.


**SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES**



None


**QUALIFICATIONS**


***Education, Certifications and/or licenses:***


* High School diploma or equivalent required.


* Bachelor’s degree preferred and/or equivalent training and work experience


* Ability to hold a Solicitor’s Permit where required.


* Valid driver’s license and ability to operate a motor vehicle preferred.


**EXPERIENCE****:**


* Financial, marketing or business analysis experience; consumer packaged goods or data provider (e.g. IRI, Nielsen) background a plus.

**KNOWLEDGE/SKILLS****:**


* Highly fluent in Excel and relational database programs. Strong knowledge of Power Point.
* Must be a results oriented professional with excellent verbal/written communication skills using diplomacy and discretion as well as customer service skills.
* Ability to multi-task, work independently and/or within a team, pays attention to detail and meet deadlines.


**COMPENSATION & BENEFITS**



Empire Merchants offers a competitive compensation package including:
* Salary Range: $65,000 - $75,000 and annual bonus potential
* 16 Observed Holidays, Health Plan options (medical, dental, vision, disability coverage, life insurance, parental leave, and other voluntary plans), 401K (with Company Contributions), PTO, vacation accrual, Flexible Spending Account and Pre-Tax Transit Commuter Program, industry certifications (WSET), tuition reimbursement and more.
* The range is an estimate for this position. The company will evaluate a specific candidate's education, skills and experience when making an offer.


**PHYSICAL DEMANDS**



The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job.



While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to use hands to finger, handle, or feel; reach with hands and arms; stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl; and talk or hear. The employee frequently is required to stand, walk, sit, and climb or balance. The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to fifty pounds. The employee must frequently lift and/or move up to ten pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and ability to adjust focus.


*Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions*


**WORKING CONDITIONS AND ENVIRONMENT**



This work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounter while performing the essential functions of this job.



While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly exposed to a normal business office environment and is occasionally exposed to work near moving mechanical parts and high precarious locations. The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate.

  




Empire Merchants Metro LLC is a leading distributor of spirits and fine wines. We are the critical link between the companies that produce alcoholic beverages and the retail outlets where they are sold, or the restaurants and pubs where they are consumed.



We are seeking motivated people to join our team in a variety of functions, including education and training, finance, marketing, logistics and operations, delivery, and customer service.


**EEO Policy Statement**



Empire Merchants Metro is an equal opportunity employer and, as such, affirms in policy and practice to recruit, hire, train, and promote, in all job classifications, without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, citizenship, sex, age, veteran status, disability, genetic information, or any other protected characteristic. Empire Merchants Metro will not discriminate against persons because of their disability, including disabled veterans, and will make reasonable accommodations for known physical or mental limitations of qualified employees and applicants with disabilities. title: Associate Specialist, Solution Architecture - Rahway, NJ
description:
**Job Description**


The IT Automation Solutions Architect is responsible for assisting with the design of automation solutions. The role supports our standard Automation Frameworks, processes, and methodologies across our product line. The role will assist other team members in creating automation design / build, and cataloging of IT products on a self-service portal, and driving delivery and cost elasticity of automation efforts. The role also works with internal Technical Subject-Matter Experts, across various IT global teams to understand the business outcomes required of IT automation. The incumbent will provide hands-on knowledge of automation and orchestration tools and technologies and participate in the end-to-end technical aspects of each automation project. The incumbent will also refine and maintain our reference architecture.


Key requirements of the role include:

* Participation in developing the IT automation strategy for one or more platforms / products in the IT organization.
* Contributing to the strategy to develop and enhance the automation platform(s) on a continuous basis and updates the technology plan.
* Collaborating with IT architects to determine impacts of new technologies on the architecture roadmap.
* Interacting with technology brokers/vendors to identify and evaluate new technology products for the platform(s).

**Required Experience:**

* Minimum of 1 year of relevant IT experience
* Experience with IT platform/service/product delivery, direct business engagement, and multiple technology domains.
* Ability to communicate and build relationships outside IT.
* Process optimization.
* Development experience / knowledge with Node JS, scripting or other programming languages.

**Preferred Experience:**

* Visual design and presentation of architecture proposals
* Ability to influence others and participate in cross-functional planning and collaboration
* Creative thinking and the ability to learn and adopt new technologies
* High level knowledge of AWS services and DevSecOps
* Experience with orchestration concepts and tools
* Ability to design and create automation workflows
* Agile development methodologies and experience in working with collaboration tools (JIRA, Confluence, SharePoint)
* Experience with cloud services like AWS and Azure is a plus
* Working with architectural concepts and demonstrating extensive knowledge of modern technologies


Education Minimum Requirement:

* High school diploma

title: Executive Director, Commercial Data Science & GenAI
description:
**Job Description**


In alignment with our company strategy to enable innovation, growth and productivity by digital and data capabilities, Human Health (HH) has created the Human Health Digital, Data and Analytics (HHDDA) organization. This central organization is focused on using digital, data, and analytics capabilities across the end-to-end commercialization process to drive data-driven decision making on behalf of our patients and customers.


As HHDDA continues its transformation to bring premier capabilities to Human Health, we are seeking a dynamic talent for the role of Head of Commercial Data Science & GenAI capability. As the Data Science & GenAI lead, this individual will drive & demonstrate patient, customer & business values and deliver on digital data analytics transformation across HH through rigorous & innovative data science methodologies & setting enterprise data science standards & reusability and leading a thriving data science talent community across HH. This individual will lead a cross functional team on the development and scale-up of AI/ML/GenAI powered products in support of commercial data and analytics activities for our HH portfolio in collaboration with cross functional team members across the enterprise.


The combined role will lead a global team of data scientists & external partners and will evolve the team over the next 2-3 years in line with business priorities. The role is based in Rahway, NJ, and will report to the Head of Data Science & Visualization for Human Health in the US. The scope is to cover all therapeutic areas and prioritized markets across the globe.


The preferred candidate will have an entrepreneurial spirit, consultative mindset, and an ability to develop analytics solutions to inform commercial strategies. They will have demonstrated consistently strong leadership skills and an ability to hire, motivate and manage large end-to-end analytics teams. This role will require interfacing and collaborating with many teams so strong communication and influencing skills are a must.

**Primary Responsibilities:**

* Provide thought leadership, education and partnership to the business on the transformative potential of AI/ML and generative AI technologies to drive commercial strategies and decision-making
* Guide the development of data science-powered products and solutions in close collaboration with cross-functional business and technical teams, aligning to key priorities
* Lead the standardization and operationalization of advanced AI/ML, generative AI, MLOps, and LLMOps capabilities across our digital product ecosystem to support the Human Health business
* Develop and deploy comprehensive playbooks to enable analytics practitioners across the organization to rapidly deliver on prioritized use cases
* Build and lead a high-performing team of top-tier generative AI experts to develop and leverage our proprietary platform, supporting hundreds of use cases
* Deliver responsible & impactful Generative AI use cases using the proprietary platform, facilitating rapid innovation & capability development
* Build a motivated analytics team; promote top talent in analytics and at the interface of data science, technology, and business
* Shape the hiring criteria and development programs of the capability team to mature data science capabilities across regions in line with business demand
* Contribute to a data-centric organizational environment that enables for empowerment of data scientists across HHDDA & HH team members
* Drive Design Thinking discipline to shape business demand and co-develop digital solutions with cross-functional teams
* Keep abreast of emerging business and analytic trends in the industry and collaborate closely with capability team to apply new techniques to drive effective decision-making
* Understand stakeholders' priorities and help build solutions that support business objectives
* Contribute to innovative experiments, specifically to idea generation, idea incubation and/or experimentation
* Keep abreast of new trends and methodologies being implemented / considered within the broader digital, data, analytics industry ecosystem and with our key customers
* Establish and manage local relationships with vendor partner ecosystem
* Lead agile working teams, cross-functional stakeholder groups and act as a solution partner for product development efforts
* Lead the creation of a comprehensive talent strategy for data and analytics professionals that includes onboarding, upskilling, career paths, and community
* Embody our company's Ways of Working: Operate as One Team, Focus on What Matters, Act with Urgency & Treat Everyone with Dignity & Respect

**Education:**

* Bachelor's Degree

**Required Experience and Skills:**

* 12+ years of experience in consulting, data analytics project delivery and managerial roles
* 10+ years of relevant experience in AI, Machine Learning, quantitative methods, predictive modeling, and other analytics frameworks/techniques
* 8+ years direct people management experience with a proven track record in performance management, talent development, and coaching
* Deep understanding of the pharmaceutical industry, market dynamics, and commercial operations
* Recognized as a thought leader and innovator in the development of new tools, healthcare data ecosystems, and problem-solving approaches for data analytics
* Experience leading ideation and delivery of commercial decision support and insights platforms
* Excellent interpersonal, oral, and written communication skills, with the ability to convey complex ideas with clarity and focus
* Demonstrated ability to manage large, geographically distributed teams with matrix reporting lines
* Self-motivated, proactive, and able to work independently with minimal direction Proven leadership and influencing skills, along with good analytical / problem-solving skills
* Excellent organizational skills, with ability to navigate a complex matrix environment
* Demonstrated ability to collaborate and lead with diverse groups of work colleagues and positively manage ambiguity
* Strong compliance mindset and ability to lead a high performing compliant innovative organization.
* Brings high energy and passionate outlook to the role and has a strong sense of leadership
* Undergraduate degree in analytics/quantitative related discipline
* Proven ability to lead in a fast-paced, transformative environment

 **Preferred Experience and Skills:**

* Master’s degree in business administration, Analytics, Engineering, Computer science or relevant quantitative field
* Prior experience building and leading a large end-to-end commercial analytics organization

**NOTICE FOR INTERNAL APPLICANTS**


In accordance with Managers' Policy - Job Posting and Employee Placement, all employees subject to this policy are required to have a minimum of twelve (12) months of service in current position prior to applying for open positions.


If you have been offered a separation benefits package, but have not yet reached your separation date and are offered a position within the salary and geographical parameters as set forth in the Summary Plan Description (SPD) of your separation package, then you are no longer eligible for your separation benefits package. To discuss in more detail, please contact your HRBP or Talent Acquisition Advisor.

**Employees working in roles that the Company determines require routine collaboration with external stakeholders, such as customer-facing commercial, or research-based roles, will be expected to comply not only with Company policy but also with policies established by such external stakeholders (for example, a requirement to be vaccinated against COVID-19 in order to access a facility or meet with stakeholders). Please understand that, as permitted by applicable law, if you have not been vaccinated against COVID-19 and an essential function of your job is to call on external stakeholders who require vaccination to enter their premises or engage in face-to-face meetings, then your employment may pose an undue burden to business operations, in which case you may not be offered employment, or your employment could be terminated. title: Real Estate Agent Partner
description:
### **Summary**


Join **The Melnikoff Real Estate Experience** as a **Real Estate Agent Partner** and become an integral part of our vibrant team committed to delivering outstanding service to our clients. Based at **1700 Route 23, Wayne, USA, 07470**, we are on the lookout for motivated and enthusiastic individuals who are passionate about real estate and eager to advance their careers. As a Real Estate Agent Partner, you will thrive in a collaborative environment, benefit from continuous training, and utilize our extensive network to reach your professional aspirations. If you are driven, customer-centric, and ready to make a significant impact, we want to hear from you!

### **Responsibilities**

* **Assist clients** in buying, selling, and renting properties, ensuring a seamless and positive experience.
* **Conduct market research** to stay updated on property values, trends, and competitive listings.
* **Prepare and present** detailed property listings, including high-quality photos and accurate descriptions.
* **Negotiate contracts** and agreements, ensuring favorable terms for clients while maintaining compliance with legal standards.
* **Coordinate property showings** and open houses, providing potential buyers with comprehensive information and tours.
* **Build and maintain relationships** with clients, industry professionals, and local communities to generate leads and referrals.
* **Utilize CRM software** to manage client interactions, track progress, and follow up on leads efficiently.

### **Qualifications**

* **Valid Real Estate License** in the state of New Jersey
* **Minimum 2 years of experience** in real estate sales or a related field
* **Proven track record** of successful real estate transactions
* **Strong knowledge** of local real estate market trends and regulations
* **Excellent communication and negotiation skills**
* **Proficient in CRM software** and other real estate technology tools
* **Ability to work independently** and as part of a team
* **High level of professionalism** and ethical standards
* **Strong organizational skills** and attention to detail
* **Reliable transportation** and willingness to travel within the service area
* **Flexibility to work evenings and weekends** as needed
* **Bachelor’s degree** in Business, Real Estate, or a related field is preferred

### **About-our-team**


At The Melnikoff Real Estate Experience, we strive to provide our clients with the highest level of service. We do this through superior technology that maximizes the reach of our efforts, teamwork & supportive collaboration, deliberately-formed positive habits, and a culture of exceptional performance. We show up daily with a smile and a positive attitude toward breaking previous records. Our clients realize success because we invest in our people. When committed individuals have the education, tools, and support they need to thrive, excellence is achieved. Join us and get ready to be the best version of yourself.

description:

### **Join The Melnikoff Real Estate Experience as a Real Estate Buyers Agent**


Embark on a fulfilling career in the ever-evolving real estate industry with The Melnikoff Real Estate Experience. Conveniently located on Rte 23 in Wayne, USA, our team is committed to offering top-notch training and support to ensure your success.


As a Buyers Agent, you will have the unique opportunity to work closely with clients, guiding them through the exciting journey of purchasing their dream homes. Whether you are a newcomer to the industry or an experienced professional looking to elevate your career, our comprehensive training program will provide you with the essential skills and knowledge to excel.

* **Conduct property showings** and provide detailed information about each property to prospective buyers.
* **Negotiate purchase agreements** and contracts with buyers and sellers to ensure a fair and smooth transaction.
* **Coordinate with mortgage lenders, inspectors, and other professionals** to ensure all aspects of the home buying process are handled efficiently.
* **Stay updated on real estate market trends** and local community developments to provide clients with the most current information.

title: Manufacturing Supervisor
description:
Thank you for your interest in becoming part of the team at Legrand!
GENERAL PURPOSE
This position is responsible for directing and supervising department personnel and all associated activities. Implement Lean manufacturing systems and strategy to ensure a safe work environment, maximize profitable growth, drive quality improvements, provide exceptional customer service, develop a technically qualified work force, reduce operating costs and lead times through continuous improvements. Oversee day-to-day activities to meet daily, monthly, quarterly and yearly expectations.
DUTIES AND ACCOUNTABILITIES* Schedule production floor work according to job priorities and reevaluate the work load numerous times throughout the day
* Monitor headcount and increase or decrease the work force utilizing a temporary work force to ensure sufficient capacity to meet internal and external customer’s needs
* Ensure that products are made to print and are held to the highest quality standards
* Ensure that all operators are following the proper processes and procedures that are required in the performance of their daily duties
* Work with the Planning team and the Manufacturing Engineering team to analyze and solve work flow problems to maximize efficiency and product output
* Lead daily production meeting and provide status updates on sales orders that have missed their scheduled ship dates
* Review, update and manage the production floor employee’s Time & Attendance records in the Time Management System
* Work with the Planning team to investigate inventory discrepancies and help identify the root cause for the discrepancy, and then implement procedural changes to eliminate these root cause issues
* Act as a liaison between multiple functional areas to resolve issues that affect the production and the delivery of product
* Initiate or suggest plans to motivate workers to achieve shop floor metrics
* Responsible for all aspects of performance management including interviewing, hiring, training, performance evaluations, and recognition
* Provide effective, constructive and appropriate feedback and leadership to direct reports to foster positive, team atmosphere
* Ensure personal and professional development of direct reports
* Confer with management or subordinates to resolve worker problems, complaints, or concerns
* Initiate and assist with the creation, development, and implementation of processes and procedures
* Conduct daily safety checks, weekly safety meetings and participate in safety committee audits
* Understand workplace hazards and take steps to proactively prevent and report hazards or injuries in the workplace. Cooperate in Safety Programs, initiatives, and investigations
* Demonstrate our five core values of Integrity, Customer Responsiveness, Innovation, Passionate Contribution & Empowerment and Continuous Improvement
* Perform other duties deemed necessary to support the Company’s business operations


JOB REQUIREMENTS
Essential Knowledge, Skills and Abilities Required:* Proven ability to manage people; train and motivate employees, as well as delegate effectively
* Dependable and enthusiastic with the ability to use good judgment, work independently with minimal direction, and possess a strong initiative and positive attitude
* Ability to thrive and perform well under pressure and meet deadlines
* Strong process focus – ability to recommend and implement changes in processes to improvement efficiency and performance
* Excellent interpersonal skills
* Ability to interpret standards, specifications, procedures, drawings, etc.
* Proven knowledge and application of Lean Manufacturing Principles. (Kanban, 7S, Value Stream Mapping, Single Piece Flow…..)
* Understanding of MRP inputs and outputs
* Proven ability to present facts and recommendations effectively in oral and written form
* Must possess high degree of professionalism and ability to handle confidential information
* Must be detailed orientated and have excellent follow-through skills
* Proven ability to present facts and recommendations effectively in oral and written form
* Strong problem solving and analytical skills
* Must have the ability to make recommendations to effectively resolve problems or issues, by using judgment that is consistent with standards, practices, policies, procedures, regulation or government law
* Strong metric focus
* Proficient in the use of personal computers, internet and Microsoft Office suite of software including Word, Excel and Outlook (or related e-mail system)
* High math aptitude
* Ability to read, write and speak English fluently


Minimum Education and Experience Required:* Bachelor’s degree with a minimum of (2) years of supervisory/management experience in a manufacturing environment or 5-7 years of experience in a manufacturing environment or combination of relevant education and experience.
* Previous experience with ERP systems


Special Job Requirements:* Ability to work long hours and weekends as required to support the core business needs


Preferred Qualifications:* Project management and planning skills
* SAP Knowledge
* Production Planning system experience


WORKING CONDITIONS/PHYSICAL DEMANDS* While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to stand, reach above shoulder level, reach below knee level, bend/twist/stoop, squat/kneel, climb, and regularly lift/carry, up to 60 lbs.; and occasionally up to 75 lbs. as needed. Also may include pushing/pulling up to 100 lbs. Regularly requires coordinated movements of the fingers for data entry on a keyboard.
* Steel-toed shoes are required for working in this position
* Regular shop assembly/distribution center environment (no air conditioning)

*Note: Nothing in this job description restricts management’s right to assign or reassign duties and responsibilities to this job at any time.**Legrand AV is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. You will be considered for this position based upon your experience and education, without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, ancestry; marital, disabled or veteran status. We are committed to creating and maintaining a workforce environment that is free from any form of discrimination or harassment.*
If you'd like to work in a fun, creative, business-casual environment that offers a comprehensive benefit package, we encourage you to apply!
Legrand is an equal employment opportunity employer.
For California residents, please see the link for the Privacy Notice for Candidates. California law requires that we provide you this notice about the collection and use of your personal Information.
